alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 7:31PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 815 PM MDT... At 729 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles south of Vona to 22 miles west of Cheyenne Wells to 4 miles west of Kit Carson to 11 miles north of Haswell. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph. Reduced visibility associated with blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kit Carson around 740 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds associated with these storms may result in areas of reduced visibility associated with blowing dust. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
